answers.answer: Hello,Hormone replacement therapy can cause blood clots or vascular changes which in turn can cause tingling ensations. Such tingling can be due to parasthesia. It is due to dysfunctioning of neurons. It can be due to diabetes, hypothyroidism, peripheral vascular disease, vitamin B12 deficiency or malnutrition.Get your blood sugar and thyroid hormones levels evaluated. You can take some vit B12 for some days and see if the symptoms improve. If the symptoms persist then get the above mentioned possibilities ruled out from a neurologist.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.
hello         Ive been taking vitaminb for three weeks and seem to be feeling much better thankyou for the advise

question: I  have just had a hysterectomy six weeks ago and have been suffering with fuzzy head and no feeling in my arms and legs doctor has put me on hrt tablets Elleste solo and now i have been getting a tingling sensation in my whole body is this side effects to tablets
title: womens health
